outcome: /JUDGMENT IN CC 1333/2012 of J.M.F.C., KODUNGALLUR PETITIONER (S) /PETITIONERS/ACCUSED NOS.1 & 3: 1. KOCHUKHADEEJA, AGED 75 YEARS W/O.SYNUDHEEN, KADAMBOT HOUSE, CHANDAPURABHAGAM, LOKESWARAM VILLAGE. 2
full_text: cae ea! 2014/KER/247 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT : THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE HARUN-UL-RASHID THURSDAY, THE 2ND DAY OF JANUARY 2014/12TH POUSHA, 1935 Cr1.MC.No. 6121 of 2013 () AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 1333/2012 of J.M.F.C., KODUNGALLUR PETITIONER (S) /PETITIONERS/ACCUSED NOS.1 & 3: 1. KOCHUKHADEEJA, AGED 75 YEARS W/O.SYNUDHEEN, KADAMBOT HOUSE, CHANDAPURABHAGAM, LOKESWARAM VILLAGE. 2. OMANA, AGED 46 YEARS W/O.SABU, BELOW KOYIPURAM SCHOOL, VAZHAPPILLY CHANGANASSERY, KOTTAYAM. BY ADV. SMI.ANITHA MATHAI MUTHIRENTHY RESPONDENT /COMPLAINANT : STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE CIRLCE INSPECTOR OF POLICE MALA POLICE STATION THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT.SAREENA GEORGE THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Pn a eee! 2014/KER/247 HARUN-UL-RASHID, J. Dated this the 2 day of January, 2014 ORDER Petitioners are the accused Nos.1 and 3 in Crime No.542/2003 of Kodungallur Police Station now pending as C.C.No.1333/2012 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kodungallur. The offences alleged are punishable under Sections 3(1), 4(1) & 5 (1) of Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act, 1956. 2. It is submitted that, the 1* petitioner is aged 75 years and the 2" petitioner 46 years that, the case is stands posted to 16.06.2014 that, no summons is issued to witnesses and that it will take several years for a final verdict in this case. The prayer in this case is for an early disposal of C.C.No.1333/2012 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kodungallur. 3. In the facts and circumstances, this Court directed the Registry to call for a report from the Chief Judicial Magistrate, Thrissur to ascertain whether the case is ripe for trial and by what time the matter can be disposed of. Pursuant to the direction, the Chief Judicial Magistrate, Thrissur through the communication dated 21.12.2013 informed the Registrar that Bees al ae ees! 2014/KER/247 Crl.M.C.No.6121 of 2013 2 the case can be advanced and can be disposed of within a period of three months. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. There will be a direction to the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kodungallur to dispose of C.C.No.1333/2012 within a period of three months from the date of receipt of a copy of this order. HARUN-UL-RASHID, JUDGE. AV
